subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Great Awakenings in America
description: A fast breakdown of The Great Awakenings in America for builders.

hook.text: America had four religious explosions. Each one reshaped politics, culture, and the meaning of being American.

buildup.text: The First Great Awakening (1730s) brought emotional, personal faith. Preachers like Jonathan Edwards terrified crowds.

discovery.text: The Second Awakening (1800s) birthed abolition, temperance, and women's suffrage. Revival created social reform.

twist.text: Modern evangelical Christianity traces directly to these awakenings. Today's culture wars have 18th-century roots.

climax.text: American Christianity is uniquely revivalist: it periodically reinvents itself in waves of passionate renewal.

punchline.text: America's faith keeps exploding and reinventing. Revival is its pattern.

quiz.question: What social movements did the Second Great Awakening inspire?
